items.sentence: Tom's daughter was born on his 30th birthday.
Tom was worried that he might miss the train.
You want to be like everyone else, don't you?
Tom was the one who ate all the strawberries.
I'm afraid that I can't make it at that time.
Don't let your emotions dictate your actions.
We're so busy we'll take any help we can get.
I'm afraid I've addressed the parcel wrongly.
I have no one to talk about my problems with.
You shouldn't worry about his eccentricities.
I'm not accustomed to walking long distances.
Tom is a member of a motor enthusiasts' club.
I didn't really think that Tom would do that.
What're the chances Tom will want to do that?
What're the chances Tom will have to do that?
I don't think that Tom will enjoy doing that.
I don't think Tom knows why I had to do that.
I don't think Tom knows why I didn't do that.
I don't think that Tom knows when I did that.
I don't think doing that would be a bad idea.
